fields.description:
*Assessment*

Currently, the cloud property experimental.dns.recursive.enabled only affects recursive lookups done from within an instance.  Is there a way to disable recursive lookups from clients that are outside the cloud that are doing recursive lookups against public DNS names of instances (e.g. similar to the bind DNS [recursive|http://www.zytrax.com/books/dns/ch7/queries.html#recursion] configuration option under the [view|http://www.zytrax.com/books/dns/ch7/view.html] clause)?  This is to stop DNS amplifier attacks.  A good example of this can be found [here|http://www.zytrax.com/books/dns/ch7/view.html] under _'split' DNS using views_ section.

*Signs*

_With experimental.dns.recursive.enabled set to true_
{code}

### From within an instance ###

ubuntu@euca-172-17-113-149:~$ dig www.google.com @10.104.1.216 +recurse

; <<>> DiG 9.9.2-P1 <<>> www.google.com @10.104.1.216 +recurse
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 34613
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 5, AUTHORITY: 4, ADDITIONAL: 5

;; OPT PSEUDOSECTION:
; EDNS: version: 0, flags:; udp: 4096
;; QUESTION SECTION:
;www.google.com.			IN	A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
www.google.com.		212	IN	A	74.125.224.115
www.google.com.		212	IN	A	74.125.224.116
www.google.com.		212	IN	A	74.125.224.112
www.google.com.		212	IN	A	74.125.224.113
www.google.com.		212	IN	A	74.125.224.114

;; AUTHORITY SECTION:
google.com.		18150	IN	NS	ns1.google.com.
google.com.		18150	IN	NS	ns3.google.com.
google.com.		18150	IN	NS	ns2.google.com.
google.com.		18150	IN	NS	ns4.google.com.

;; ADDITIONAL SECTION:
ns1.google.com.		26603	IN	A	216.239.32.10
ns3.google.com.		26603	IN	A	216.239.36.10
ns2.google.com.		26603	IN	A	216.239.34.10
ns4.google.com.		26603	IN	A	216.239.38.10

;; Query time: 138 msec
;; SERVER: 10.104.1.216#53(10.104.1.216)
;; WHEN: Wed Oct 16 16:32:25 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 259

### from outside the cloud ###

euca-prod-1-82:~ haroldspencerjr$ dig euca-10-104-7-10.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com @10.104.1.216 +recurse

; <<>> DiG 9.8.3-P1 <<>> euca-10-104-7-10.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com @10.104.1.216 +recurse
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 51162
;; flags: qr aa rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;euca-10-104-7-10.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com. IN A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
euca-10-104-7-10.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com. 60 IN A 10.104.7.10

;; Query time: 235 msec
;; SERVER: 10.104.1.216#53(10.104.1.216)
;; WHEN: Wed Oct 16 12:29:48 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 94
{code}

_With  experimental.dns.recursive.enabled set to false_
{code}

### from within the instance ###

ubuntu@euca-172-17-113-149:~$ dig www.google.com @10.104.1.216 +recurse
;; Warning: query response not set

; <<>> DiG 9.9.2-P1 <<>> www.google.com @10.104.1.216 +recurse
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: SERVFAIL, id: 43260
;; flags: rd ad; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0
;; WARNING: recursion requested but not available

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;www.google.com.			IN	A

;; Query time: 21 msec
;; SERVER: 10.104.1.216#53(10.104.1.216)
;; WHEN: Wed Oct 16 16:31:27 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 32

### from outside the cloud ###

euca-prod-1-82:~ haroldspencerjr$ dig euca-10-104-7-10.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com @10.104.1.216 +recurse

; <<>> DiG 9.8.3-P1 <<>> euca-10-104-7-10.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com @10.104.1.216 +recurse
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 42118
;; flags: qr aa rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;euca-10-104-7-10.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com. IN A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
euca-10-104-7-10.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com. 60 IN A 10.104.7.10

;; Query time: 222 msec
;; SERVER: 10.104.1.216#53(10.104.1.216)
;; WHEN: Wed Oct 16 12:32:15 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 94
{code}

*Steps*

* Set up a Eucalyptus 3.3.2 cloud
* Enable Eucalyptus DNS
* Make sure experimental.dns.recursive.enabled is set to true, and do the following:
** Test recursive lookup from within instance
** Test recursive lookup from client outside the cloud
* Change experimental.dns.recursive.enabled to false, and do the following:
** Test recursive lookup from within instance
** Test recursive lookup from client outside the cloud

*Pertinent Data*

To turn off recursive lookups from external clients is a best practice for security and performance reasons.  Refer to [RFC-5358|http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc5358.txt]

*Workaround*

N/A
fields.summary: Recursive option in Eucalyptus DNS Doesn't Support Separate Views (Split-Horizon)

comments.body:
As [RFC-5358|http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc5358.txt] Mentions:

{code}
In nameservers that do not need to be providing recursive service,
   for instance servers that are meant to be authoritative only, turn
   recursion off completely.  In general, it is a good idea to keep
   recursive and authoritative services separate as much as practical.
   This, of course, depends on local circumstances.

 Even with all these recommendations, network operators should
   consider deployment of ingress filtering [BCP38] in routers to
   prevent use of address spoofing as a viable course of action.  In
   situations where more complex network setups are in place, "Ingress
   Filtering for Multihomed Network" [BCP84] maybe a useful additional
   reference.

   By default, nameservers SHOULD NOT offer recursive service to
   external networks.
{code}

For security reasons, I'm relying on a blacklist of attackers from here https://github.com/smurfmonitor.  Rather than disable recursion (due to this issue), we're filtering some known nasties via iptables.
please check this out for possible inclusion in 3.4.1

I saw something weird here as well regarding recursive lookups regarding DNS lookups done from within the instance.   Here is a summary:

* Eucalyptus DNS running on 10.104.10.6:
{code}
$ sudo euca-describe-services
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.216   	ENABLED   	28  	http://10.104.1.216:8773/services/Dns   	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.1.216/
{code}
* Instance launched with the following information in the /etc/resolv.conf:
{code}
ubuntu@euca-172-17-188-236:~$ cat /etc/resolv.conf
# Dynamic resolv.conf(5) file for glibc resolver(3) generated by resolvconf(8)
#     DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE BY HAND -- YOUR CHANGES WILL BE OVERWRITTEN
nameserver 10.104.10.6
nameserver 8.8.8.8
search eucalyptus.internal
{code}
* Use _nslookup_ for an external IP, resolution happens:
{code}
ubuntu@euca-172-17-188-236:~$ date; nslookup 10.104.1.216; date
Thu Dec  5 06:59:58 PST 2013
Server:		10.104.10.6
Address:	10.104.10.6#53

Non-authoritative answer:
216.1.104.10.in-addr.arpa	name = odc-d-06-07.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com.

Authoritative answers can be found from:
104.10.in-addr.arpa	nameserver = ns1.eucalyptus-systems.com.
ns1.eucalyptus-systems.com	internet address = 10.1.1.254

Thu Dec  5 06:59:59 PST 2013
{code}
* Use _dig_ and resolution doesn't work:
{code}
ubuntu@euca-172-17-188-236:~$ date; dig 10.104.1.216; date
Thu Dec  5 07:00:11 PST 2013
;; Warning: query response not set

; <<>> DiG 9.9.2-P1 <<>> 10.104.1.216
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: SERVFAIL, id: 64008
;; flags: rd ad; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0
;; WARNING: recursion requested but not available

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;10.104.1.216.			IN	A

;; Query time: 962 msec
;; SERVER: 10.104.10.6#53(10.104.10.6)
;; WHEN: Thu Dec  5 07:00:11 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 30

Thu Dec  5 07:00:11 PST 2013
{code}
* Log entry from nslookup and dig responses:
{code}
# grep "Thu Dec 5 06\:59" /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.3 | grep DnsResolvers
Thu Dec 5 06:59:01 2013  WARN [StaticPropertyEntry:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#12] [com.eucalyptus.configurable.StaticPropertyEntry.getValue(StaticPropertyEntry.java):126] Failed to get property: dns.enabled because of example: [StaticDatabasePropertyEntry fieldName=com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.enabled value=null propName=dns.enabled id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null]
Thu Dec 5 06:59:21 2013  WARN [StaticPropertyEntry:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#2] [com.eucalyptus.configurable.StaticPropertyEntry.getValue(StaticPropertyEntry.java):126] Failed to get property: dns.enabled because of example: [StaticDatabasePropertyEntry fieldName=com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.enabled value=null propName=dns.enabled id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null]
Thu Dec 5 06:59:41 2013  WARN [StaticPropertyEntry:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#12] [com.eucalyptus.configurable.StaticPropertyEntry.getValue(StaticPropertyEntry.java):126] Failed to get property: dns.enabled because of example: [StaticDatabasePropertyEntry fieldName=com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.enabled value=null propName=dns.enabled id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null]
Thu Dec 5 06:59:42 2013 DEBUG [DnsResolvers:Thread-41] [com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.findRecords(DnsResolvers.java):510] DnsResolvers.findRecords(): resolvers for eucalyptus.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com. are: [TopologyDnsResolver]
Thu Dec 5 06:59:42 2013 DEBUG [DnsResolvers:Thread-41] [com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.lookupRecords(DnsResolvers.java):445] DnsResolver: A eucalyptus.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com.
Thu Dec 5 06:59:42 2013 DEBUG [LoggingResetter:New I/O worker #203] [com.eucalyptus.system.log.LoggingResetter.resetLogLevel(LoggingResetter.java):190] Logger com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers level unspecified, leaving as is.
Thu Dec 5 06:59:50 2013 DEBUG [DnsResolvers:Thread-41] [com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.findRecords(DnsResolvers.java):510] DnsResolvers.findRecords(): resolvers for 216.1.104.10.in-addr.arpa. are: [RecursiveDnsResolver]
Thu Dec 5 06:59:50 2013 DEBUG [DnsResolvers:Thread-41] [com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.lookupRecords(DnsResolvers.java):445] DnsResolver: PTR 216.1.104.10.in-addr.arpa.
Thu Dec 5 06:59:51 2013 DEBUG [DnsResolvers:Thread-41] [com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.findRecords(DnsResolvers.java):510] DnsResolvers.findRecords(): resolvers for 216.1.104.10.in-addr.arpa. are: [RecursiveDnsResolver]
Thu Dec 5 06:59:52 2013 DEBUG [DnsResolvers:Thread-41] [com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.lookupRecords(DnsResolvers.java):445] DnsResolver: PTR 216.1.104.10.in-addr.arpa.
Thu Dec 5 06:59:57 2013  WARN [StaticPropertyEntry:Eucalyptus.node:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:cluster:node:com.eucalyptus.component.Topology-10.105.10.11-10.105.10.11/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#263] [com.eucalyptus.configurable.StaticPropertyEntry.getValue(StaticPropertyEntry.java):126] Failed to get property: dns.enabled because of example: [StaticDatabasePropertyEntry fieldName=com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.enabled value=null propName=dns.enabled id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null]
Thu Dec 5 06:59:59 2013 DEBUG [DnsResolvers:Thread-41] [com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.findRecords(DnsResolvers.java):510] DnsResolvers.findRecords(): resolvers for 216.1.104.10.in-addr.arpa. are: [RecursiveDnsResolver]
Thu Dec 5 06:59:59 2013 DEBUG [DnsResolvers:Thread-41] [com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.lookupRecords(DnsResolvers.java):445] DnsResolver: PTR 216.1.104.10.in-addr.arpa.
{code}
{code}
# grep "Thu Dec 5 07\:00" /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.3 | grep DnsResolvers
Thu Dec 5 07:00:11 2013 DEBUG [DnsResolvers:Thread-41] [com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.findRecords(DnsResolvers.java):510] DnsResolvers.findRecords(): resolvers for 10.104.1.216. are: [RecursiveDnsResolver]
Thu Dec 5 07:00:11 2013 DEBUG [DnsResolvers:Thread-41] [com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.lookupRecords(DnsResolvers.java):445] DnsResolver: A 10.104.1.216.
Thu Dec 5 07:00:11 2013  WARN [StaticPropertyEntry:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#12] [com.eucalyptus.configurable.StaticPropertyEntry.getValue(StaticPropertyEntry.java):126] Failed to get property: dns.enabled because of example: [StaticDatabasePropertyEntry fieldName=com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.enabled value=null propName=dns.enabled id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null]
Thu Dec 5 07:00:19 2013 DEBUG [LoggingResetter:New I/O worker #216] [com.eucalyptus.system.log.LoggingResetter.resetLogLevel(LoggingResetter.java):190] Logger com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers level unspecified, leaving as is.
Thu Dec 5 07:00:31 2013  WARN [StaticPropertyEntry:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#2] [com.eucalyptus.configurable.StaticPropertyEntry.getValue(StaticPropertyEntry.java):126] Failed to get property: dns.enabled because of example: [StaticDatabasePropertyEntry fieldName=com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.enabled value=null propName=dns.enabled id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null]

Uploaded sosreport for recent nslookup/dig test.
[~lwade] no. I believe it's on target for 4.0.

[~kedwards] git show 65398112169fb683e334d6e9e713c39185f7eafe

I think this fix is important and no-side effect for 3.4.2.

Fixed.

When {{dns.recursive.enabled}} is set to {{true}}, DNS lookup from outside the cloud does not send query response.

{noformat}
[root@b-14 ~]# euca-describe-properties dns.recursive.enabled
PROPERTY	dns.recursive.enabled	true
{noformat}

{noformat}
[root@d-20 ~]# dig www.google.com  @10.111.1.14 +recurse
;; Warning: query response not set

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.23.rc1.el6_5.1 <<>> www.google.com @10.111.1.14 +recurse
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: SERVFAIL, id: 6869
;; flags: rd; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0
;; WARNING: recursion requested but not available

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;www.google.com.			IN	A

;; Query time: 86 msec
;; SERVER: 10.111.1.14#53(10.111.1.14)
;; WHEN: Sun Feb 16 22:39:49 2014
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 32

{noformat}

*Installed Packages:*
{noformat}
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.4.2
Release     : 0.0.545.20140209git7261e020.el6
Size        : 2.4 M
Repo        : installed
{noformat}
[~mdshaonimran], [~spark], so what is the intended behaviour with this property set to false?
We should document that this property controls the view from the client, i.e. true/false is for an instances ability to perform recursive lookups.
[~lwade] when it's false, lookup from instances will not be recursive. The flag affects queries from instances. For all external queries, recursive lookup is always disabled.
